Microbiology research will be paramount to ensuring success of missions to the Moon and Mars in the next 10 years . The journey beyond low Earth orbit (LEO) will expand human civilization, enable future space settlements, provide scientific knowledge of the evolution of our planet and the solar system . Utilizing the benefits of microbes, while understanding their limitations, will help us explore deeper into space
<sup> and the built environment <sup><a href="CR26" class="usa-link" aria-describedby="CR

Beighan University’s Lunar Permanent Astrobase Life-support Artificial Closed Ecosystem (Palace) 1, comprising three cabins that work simultaneously to manage atmospheric conditions, produce crops, breed insects, and recover solid and liquid waste .
One limiting factor of regolith is the absence of reactive nitrogen, an essential nutrient for optimal plant growth and function .
Application of microalgae and cyanobacteria to the soil can improve soil fertility and health . Nascimento et al. assessed the ability of the N-fixing cyanob bacteria <em>Nostoc sp .
Microbes can also remove toxins from Martian soil such as perchlorates, which are found in high levels in Martian soil and cause a significant reduction in plant survival and productivity .

MELiSSA initiative proposed a loop of compartments that thoroughly recycle gas, liquid, and solid waste using microorganisms . Each output of the preceding compartment provides the input for the following compartment .

Plant-microbe systems can provide other methods of wastewater recycling . Plants are excellent water purifiers and can release 2–10 L of water vapor from their leaves through the process of transpiration .

The BLSS concept is based on the concept of enhanced enhanced air revitalization for space missions . The system would be able to increase the production of oxygen by cyanobacteria or algae . The process is similar to photosynthesis, the process by which plants, algae and cyanob bacteria convert sunlight, and water, into O<sub>2 kg of CO and energy .  MELiSSA is being considered for air revitalization, nitrate removal and edible biomass production in MELSSA . Another species of cyanobacteria being considered is <em>Limnospira indica .

MFC consists of two chambers, separated by a proton exchange membrane . Exoelectrogens, shown as a biofilm, anaerobically oxidize organic matter releasing protons and electrons . electrons released during the oxidation of organic matter transfer to the anode and travel to the cathode in the second chamber via an external circuit .
MFCs need to first be removed for MFC to function efficiently . This can be achieved with an alternative type of MFC called a microbial desalination cell .

MFC can generate electricity from activated sludge obtained from a sewage treatment plant for specific use within BLSS for future crewed outposts . Other organic components of wastewater, such as human feces, can be a resource for electricity generation by MFC .  " aria-describedby="CR131">131" " " " aia-described by" CR131" is aria

Gajda et al. tested a small (70 mm long, 15 m diameter, 2  mm thick) and large (100 M long, 42 cm diameter, 3 MM thick) terracotta MFC . The smaller MFC achieved a power density output 2.9-fold greater than the large MFC, at

Biomining is commonly applied to pyritic ores and completed by iron-oxidizing bacteria . The process involves specific microorganisms that secrete organic acids and metal-binding compounds that essentially dissolve these metals, allowing them to be easily extracted from the environment .

Iron is one of the most-processed metals on Earth that is incorporated in most building materials . Iron would be heavily relied on for construction, repair, and maintenance of buildings at extraterrestrial outposts .

Copper is another important metal that can be produced through biomining, with nearly 20–30% of all copper produced on Earth extracted through the process . Other economically essential elements have been found in asteroidal material and Martian regolith .  The biomining reactor has three main components: the culture chamber, the media reservoir chamber, and the fixative reservoir chamber .

The media reservoir chamber contains the nutrients required for the biomining reaction to occur and is injected into the culture chamber to begin the biomine reaction . Once the reaction is completed, a fixative is injected to halt microbial growth (section 3) Biomining for elements known to be located within Martian and lunar regolith, such as iron and REE, will be essential .
Astronaut medical toolkit for maintenance of a healthy gut microbiome, prevention and treatment of bacterial infections that may arise in future space missions .
The formation of biofilms and propagation of multi-drug resistance in the spaceflight environment limits these therapeutic options .
E. coli harboring both the motility and killing biosensor modules resulted in the killing of 60% of cells . The killing module produced antimicrobial and biofilm-degrading proteins, MccS and DNaseI .

Biological sensors to detect and/or reduce pathogenic bacteria using traditional chassis such as engineered Lactobacillus or E. coli have also been demonstrated against intestinal <em>P. aeruginosa, vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus, Candida albicans and S. aureus . Bacterial probiotics can also be engineered to detect gut inflammation by  >B. subtilis has been presented as a novel probiotic therapy as it has been shown to break down the oxalate in kidney stones in a <em>Drosophila <em>. model . OxDC enzyme derived from Bifidobacterium can also be used to engineer other bacteria as probiotics for the treatment of kidney stones .
Bacteria can also be engineered to improve tumor and metastasis visualization within mammalian hosts . Bacteria hold great potential for the development of easily modifiable biotherapeutics .

Microalgae can provide a sufficient source of proteins, carbohydrates, fatty acids, minerals, and vitamins . Genome editing technologies for these marine species have expanded over the last 20 years .
Nutrients project will provide invaluable information for the feasibility of using microbes as a platform for nutrient storage and production for long-term space travel .

Stereolithographic Apparatus for Microbial (SLAM) Bioprinting 3D printer developed using a Stereolithic Apparatu for Microbacteria . The technology can be applied to tackle specific manufacturing challenges in space .

Microgravity studies of K cheronesos found that scytalone dehydratase gene expression was upregulated in the wild-type strain and downregulated in a melanin-deficient mutant strain . This suggests that <em>Knufia species, and potentially other black fungi, have the properties to withstand space conditions and are good candidates for plastic degradation in space .

The capacity for manufacturing in space will be beneficial for long-duration space missions, reducing the need to bring materials as cargo or have them launched from Earth, and allowing for on-demand production of materials based on immediate need . The average person on Earth is exposed to about 6.2 mSv of radiation over a period of a year, while the average astronaut on the  Melanin has the capability to absorb electromagnetic radiation, resist acids, and perform powerful antioxidant activity allowing some fungi to thrive in the most extreme environments on Earth or beyond .

Biocomposites combining fungal mycelium with cellulose plant fibers or with wood and cellulose nanofibrils have also been investigated . Synthetic biology could be used to engineer fungi to secrete other useful structural components such as polymers .

The B. subtilis gene cluster and molecular mechanism involved in calcium carbonate biomineralization have been identified . The bacteria could be used to engineer novel bacteria with enhanced self-healing capabilities .
P.P. describedby="CR354">354" described by description by description of P.C. described by P.J

Some studies have concluded that while microorganisms with pathogenic potential are present in these space environments, spaceflight conditions do not lead to increased virulence or microbial characteristics that would directly impact crew health . For example, there was no significant difference in the virulence of . Burkholderia species isolated from the ISS compared to Earth controls .

The space grown TSB population was one quarter of that on Earth . Ground controls, however, were one quarter more resistant to the iodine solution in space . Those grown in space had a higher biofilm growth compared to ground controls .
Ways to detect, monitor and control biofilms are being explored . The aim of this study is to identify bacterial genes relevant to biofilm growth in space .

DNA-based biological dosimeters (phage T7, uracil thin layer, spores, and biofilms) were validated for their effectiveness in determining the biological hazards of environmental UV exposure (i.e., sunlight) They were used in a study by Rettberg et al. to determine the biological effectiveness of the UV radiation climate at different locations in the space station .

Gram-positive bacteria facilitate contact between donor and recipient cells through surface adhesins rather than conjugative pili . Authors caution the drawing of conclusions due to failure to obtain transconjugants in some replicates of ground controls .

HGT occurs in spaceflight conditions within and between Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria and is typically not hampered, and is more often increased, by space flight conditions . HGT is a normal occurrence within the human microbiome, but an increased number of transfer events passing AMR genes from commensal bacteria to opportunistic pathogens during spaceflight could cause changes in these microbial communities .  Some research has proposed that the increased virulence or pathogenicity observed in some organisms grown under spaceflight conditions is attributed to possible increased HGT . Study comparing similar species from two extreme built environments, one on Earth (Concordia Research Station in Antarctica) and one in space (ISS)
Reisner et al. confirmed Ghigo’s findings as the presence of the F plasmid pOX38 in E. coli led to the formation of mushroom-shaped biofilms .
Researchers found that long-term exposure resulted in downregulation of genes associated with fimbriae, impeding adhesion, and ultimately decreasing biofilm formation .
When coupled with CRISPR/Cas technologies conjugation can be used for the modulation of microbiomes and as a method for targeted eradication of human pathogens on Earth .

Antibacterial photodynamic inactivation employs the use of a photoactive compound which accumulates in target bacteria where it is illuminated to produce a cytotoxic reaction with oxygen resulting in cellular damage and bacterial death . Additional examples of mitigation strategies include specialized material coatings or surfaces (e.g., copper-based antimicrobial surfaces) and engineered lantibiotics .

Plant-based extracts are gaining in popularity for their antimicrobial and antibiofilm properties . Microbes are ideal candidates to aid in human survival during long-term space travel due to their many beneficial characteristics, ease of manipulation, and microscopic size .
